definition: to inherit/to follow/to adopt
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: The two entrances to the holy grottoreceived their present monumental form.
sentences.chinese: 而通往神圣地窟的两个入口承袭了他们不变的形式。

sentences.english: The Wu mainly followed the institution of the Han Dynasty except that woman was limited to a certain extent.
sentences.chinese: 孙吴基本上承袭汉制，但女性受到一定程度的限制。

sentences.english: Modern men still carry the ancient legacy of being brave and showing no weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 现代的男人依然承袭着勇敢和不示弱的古老传统。

sentences.english: "Liao sacrifice"was inherited anddeveloped by Zhou clansman.
sentences.chinese: 燎祭之典后被周族人所承袭并有所增益。

sentences.english: Yan Can not only inherited the results of traditional research on The Book of Songs, but also made bold innovations.
sentences.chinese: 严粲不仅承袭传统诗学成果，而且进行了大胆的创新。

sentences.english: Hume in many ways follows Hobbes.
sentences.chinese: 休谟在很多方面都承袭于霍布斯。

sentences.english: Their theory source could trace down the Lenins new economy policy.
sentences.chinese: 它们在理论上的承袭可以追溯到列宁的新经济政策。

sentences.english: Inherited Zongshen's excellence, every gene is crowned with perfectness.
sentences.chinese: 承袭宗申优良传统，每一个基因都有一种精堪之美。

sentences.english: Now in many ways Hume can be seen as building on Newton and Locke.
sentences.chinese: 现代很多观点认为休谟承袭于牛顿和洛克。

sentences.english: As you have stated, the legacy can change.
sentences.chinese: 正如你们所指出的，承袭的传统可以改变。

sentences.english: Some calendars in Xixia state were from Song Dynasty, some had historical relationships with that in Central Plains.
sentences.chinese: 西夏历法承袭中原历法，与宋朝历法有渊源关系。

sentences.english: With the traditional handmade pounding method, Heirui has preserved sixty years of good taste.
sentences.chinese: 承袭先人手工搥打古法，保存一甲子的纯真美味。

sentences.english: Fonteyn represents the best traditions of ballet.
sentences.chinese: 芳廷承袭了芭蕾舞艺术的最优秀的传统。

definition: to carry on as before/to follow (an old custom etc)
to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
traceable to the same stock (idiom); of a common origin (of trends, ideas etc)
succession/inheritance/hereditary
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
tradition or style from the past/old ways/surviving tradition/relic
family/clan
successor
variant of 秉承[bing3 cheng2]
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
to take orders/to receive commands/to carry on (a tradition)
for many generations/generation/era/age
to complement one another
Zhengtong Emperor, reign name of sixth Ming Emperor Zhu Qizhen 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
orthodox
the previous dynasty
